simpledb

Class StringHistogram

  • java.lang.Object
    • simpledb.StringHistogram

  • public class StringHistogram
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to represent a fixed-width histogram over a single String-based field.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) IntHistogram hist 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StringHistogram(int buckets)
      Create a new StringHistogram with a specified number of buckets.

      Estimate the selectivity (as a double between 0 and 1) of the specified predicate over the specified string

      (package private) int minVal() 
      private int stringToInt(java.lang.String s)

    • Field Detail

      • hist

        final IntHistogram hist

    • Constructor Detail

      • StringHistogram

        public StringHistogram(int buckets)
        Create a new StringHistogram with a specified number of buckets.

        Our implementation is written in terms of an IntHistogram by converting each String to an integer.

        Parameters:
        buckets - the number of buckets

    • Method Detail

      • stringToInt

        private int stringToInt(java.lang.String s)
        Convert a string to an integer, with the property that if the return value(s1) < return value(s2), then s1 < s2

      • maxVal

        int maxVal()
        Returns:
        the maximum value indexed by the histogram

      • minVal

        int minVal()
        Returns:
        the minimum value indexed by the histogram

      • addValue

        public void addValue(java.lang.String s)
        Add a new value to thte histogram

      • estimateSelectivity

        public double estimateSelectivity(Predicate.Op op,
                         java.lang.String s)
        Estimate the selectivity (as a double between 0 and 1) of the specified predicate over the specified string
        Parameters:
        op - The operation being applied
        s - The string to apply op to

      • avgSelectivity

        public double avgSelectivity()
        Returns:
        the average selectivity of this histogram. This is not an indispensable method to implement the basic join optimization. It may be needed if you want to implement a more efficient optimization
